stable_tour.quote: Entitled to come on for his first start over fences at Fairyhouse and hopefully he can pick up a beginners chase in the next few weeks. 24-10-23

runners.name: Jumping Jet
runners.comment: Last year's winner had a decent prep run at Down Royal; ground in her favour
runners.spotlight: Career highlight when winning this race last season on good ground off 121, getting up late to beat Ask Anything; decent enough prep run when second to an odds-on stablemate in 3-runner 3m2f Down Royal conditions event 13 days ago; ground to suit and one to consider.

quotes.race: Ronan Lawlor Memorial Irish EBF Mares (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Jumping Jet is a tough filly. There are no schooling bumpers at the moment and I thought other fillies with experience would catch her out but she was straight enough there. I always thought a lot of her at home and is a nice filly going forward - Barry Fitzgerald, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She will come on plenty for her return to action at Galway on Sunday where she travelled well for a long way. She's a lovely mare and will pick up plenty of prize-money again this season in those nice staying chases. There are plenty of mares' races for her as well. 28-10-24

runners.name: Stormy Judge
runners.comment: Underwhelming recent Naas run and ground here plenty quick; cheekpieces tried
runners.spotlight: 2-14 over fences, both wins on heavy; underwhelming recent Leinster National effort doesn't offer much hope and neither does the quicker ground; cheekpieces tried.

quotes.race: Tipper Road Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Stormy Judge stayed on really well today and three miles will be his trip. He can handle soft - Pat Fahy, trainer.

runners.name: Brazil
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Camas Park Stud

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Boodles winner yet to get act together chasing; big step up in trip here
runners.spotlight: Boodles winner in 2022 also a premier handicap winner on the Flat; 0-5 chasing and hasn't looked a natural jumper, most recently pulled up at Punchestown on New Year's Eve; hard to have confidence in and big step up in trip an unknown.

quotes.race: Guinness Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: It means a lot. I won it first back in 1991, this is my fifth time to win it. I was devastated when he ran bad yesterday and then I was mindful that Mark (Walsh) had pulled Brazil up. He was alive, the minute I jumped out the gates I knew I had a chance. I kept wide I didn't want to get caught in traffic, he kept rolling and I got there - Niall McCullagh, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Pre-Order @ IrishRacingYearbook.com Fishery Lane Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Brazil is a real stayer and a lovely horse to have. The other horse making a mistake two out helped us - Padraig Roche, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered as The Fred Winter) (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Paul (Townend)'s horse kept jumping right and was actually interfering with me a little bit at the second-last and I was having to pull and kick to get down his inner, because I knew Brazil would stay all day, and the line came in time for us. At the second hurdle Paul's jumped out and squashed me, and I lost a bit of ground, but we weren't going much of a gallop so I could get back into position alright - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Private Security Ltd Cleaning And Maintenance Supporting Kill GAA Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Brazil had run three nice races and it was great to get him off the mark. He handles the ground and jumped well. We'll probably campaign him at home - Padraig Roche, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Brazil stuck at it well. The first-time blinkers just helped him travel and go forward, and when the others came to me he battled well to the line. You would hope there will be plenty of improvement next year - Wayne Lordan, rider

stable_tour.quote: I was delighted with him last time when winning the Fishery Lane Hurdle at Naas. He was getting 9lb from Fil Dor, who made a mistake at the second-last that played into our hands, but we couldn't have been happier with our horse. He progressed all last season, so hopefully he can keep going in that direction. We haven't yet discussed plans for where he might head next but he came out of the race in great shape and I'm sure there could be something for him in December. With his pedigree [brother to Irish Derby and St Leger winner Capri] you'd imagine he should be able to step up in trip, but he's running well over two miles as it stands. 20-11-22

runners.name: Bodhisattva
runners.comment: Campaigning in Britain of late without success; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Long time since his sole chase win; fourth in this last year and has been travelling abroad of late, notably second in Edinburgh National (good to soft); none too fluent in Midlands National latest; hard to fancy.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bodhisattva is just a big galloper he galloped all the way to the line. He jumped really well and will make a 3-mile chaser some day - Gordon Elliott, trainer

runners.name: Iris Emery
runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie Nicolas Taudon
runners.comment: Didn't appear to stay 3m5f on handicap debut at Leopardstown; obvious stamina worries
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner has been placed on five of eight attempts chasing, notably second to smart Croke Park in 3m Fairyhouse beginners'; didn't appear to stay 3m5f on recent handicap debut at Leopardstown (claimer-ridden) so obvious stamina concerns here.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Schooling Races Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Iris Emery jumped very well and that brought me a lot of the way round. The second had some decent form pre-Christmas and I'd say for a small field it probably wasn't the worst maiden - Danny Mullins, rider.

runners.name: Peaches And Cream
runners.comment: Disputing when last-fence faller in this last year; recent form not good but 9lb lower
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since landing 3m7f Punchestown handicap nearly three years ago but every chance when last-fence faller in this race last year off 129; no show at big prices latest two starts so not an obvious one but goes on the ground and handicapper giving him a chance.

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Peaches And Cream ran a cracker in the Ulster National when I left him a little bit short. We'll see what the handicapper does but we will look at the Midlands National in July - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Slaney Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Peaches And Cream had been working well and needs a couple of runs. With the small field and the ground getting a bit softer we hoped he would run well. He's a bunny to jump and he was winging fences. He's a game sort of horse. I got there a bit soon but he stays well - Jonathan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: New Inn Opportunity Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Peaches And Cream got a break after Killarney. He's in at Listowel next week so we'll see how it goes - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well last time when third at Kelso and is going to go back there for the Borders National. He was unlucky in the Ulster National in April when falling at the last. He only cost €1,200 and has been a great servant. 12-11-24
He ran well last time when third at Kelso and is going to go back there for the Borders National.  He was unlucky in the Ulster National in April when falling at the last. 13-11-24

runners.name: Hands Of Gold
runners.comment: Hard to fancy but longer trip and better ground could see improvement
runners.spotlight: Two wins over hurdles but 0-6 chasing on soft ground, reportedly struck into at Gowran last time; some encouragement at same track previously; longer trip and better ground could see improvement; 1lb wrong.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Hands Of Gold got into a lovely rhythm and is going the right way. He is a lovely horse for the future. We will aim him for Punchestown but we will find a race in between - Arthur Moore, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Ladies Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Hands Of Gold is a grand horse that has been developing mentally and physically. This race was ideal for him. He was a big baby last year, he has an engine and he is going to make a nice chaser - Arthur Moore, trainer.

runners.name: Ringdufferin
runners.comment: Better hurdler; reportedly burst blood vessels latest; not an obvious one
runners.spotlight: Rated 127 over hurdles but has so far been unable to exploit this lower chase mark, reportedly burst blood vessels latest at Fairyhouse; 1lb wrong; not an obvious one.

quotes.race: Toals Bookmakers Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ringdufferin got an easy enough lead, but he's a horse that stays galloping and he stays well. I would have been happy to take a lead if something wanted to go on but nothing did - Jack Kennedy, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's won his last two and might now go to Cheltenham for a Pertemps qualifier. 24-10-23

runners.name: Wellington Hill
runners.comment: Better for recent comeback run but still hard to see him having an impact; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; interrupted campaign chasing and best run when third in 2m6f Fairyhouse beginners last season (soft); better for recent comeback run but still hard to see him having an impact; 1lb wrong.

quotes.race: Golf Memberships At Gowran Park Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Wellington Hill. He had a wind op last year and he's had three runs since, he's improved every day since he came back from it. He's really a chaser in the making, he's from a good family and they were all chasers - Mags Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Wine An Dine
runners.comment: Good second at Fairyhouse but below that form since and 5lb wrong here; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; hunter chase recruit ran well on handicap debut when second over 2m5f at Fairyhouse in January but hasn't reproduced that form since; 5lb wrong here.

runners.name: Broken Ice

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late W S Acham

runners.comment: Long losing run and 7lb wrong; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; sole chase win came at Sligo back in 2022 (2m5f, good to yielding) when with Gavin Cromwell; brought down at Catterick latest, this a much stronger race and 7lb wrong.

quotes.race: Brenda Anderson Memorial Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Broken Ice has been banging on the door and was entitled to win there with his chase mark. He stays well and will definitely stay further, and may even prefer slower ground - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was only sixth at Sligo the other day but was a really consistent servant prior to that and we'll mix and match it between hurdles and fences with him this season. 27-10-22

runners.name: Ballysax Hank
runners.comment: Jumping let him down on recent chase debut, better ground here could see improvement
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; good runs in defeat over hurdles last season on decent ground but pulled up on heavy ground on yard debut last month; none too fluent and beaten when unseating last on chase debut at Naas since; better ground could well see an improved showing here.

runners.name: Digby
runners.comment: Recent return to fences at Down Royal was poor so plenty of questions to answer
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over hurdles in the past; 0-8 chasing however, including third in 2m5f Sligo beginners last autumn and okay fourth in Navan novice handicap, both on good; recent return to fences at Down Royal was poor so plenty of questions to answer with blinkers tried.

quotes.race: Cawley Furniture Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Digby toughed it out and is a real stayer. He will jump a fence. We'll see how he comes out of this but I'd say we will go to Punchestown if there is something suitable - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Killarney Plaza Hotel Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Richie said Digby is a grand horse, is still a bit raw and said they went a good gallop. He said he knew from the bottom of the straight he had them covered and he stays going well. Winter ground is an unknown but has been running on quick ground and that's the softest ground he has run on yet. He has been on the go a while but we'll see what the boss man (owner Pat Conway) wants to do. He'll jump fences next year - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

runners.name: Heroes Rise
runners.comment: Okay runs in handicap hurdles of late, 5yo now tries chasing
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Listowel last summer and back to form when runner-up in a Thurles novice in December; okay runs in handicaps since and now tries chasing.

quotes.race: Shay Rooney Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The yard are in form and all the summer horses are flying. I liked Heroes Rise, he'd done nothing wrong on his previous runs, although greenness probably beat him. He travelled, settled, jumped and did everything right - Carl Millar, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won nicely at the Listowel meeting in June, but has been a shade disappointing since and didn't get home at Galway on Sunday. 28-10-24

runners.name: Step Out
runners.comment: Not discredited at Kelso latest but more needed to play a major role here; has his ground
runners.spotlight: Won 2m6f maiden hurdle here last summer (good) and decent enough efforts on first two chase outings this term; not discredited against some decent types at Kelso latest but more needed to play a major role here, although has his ground.

runners.name: Tell Nobody Nothin
runners.comment: Good hurdles form here earlier in the season; needs to jump better but time on his side
runners.spotlight: Progressive over hurdles including 2m2f maiden win here in September (good) and second in novice handicap over same C&D; didn't jump well on chase debut at Gowran and testing ground wouldn't have suited on last month's Navan comeback when cheekpieces tried; has time on his side and not one to rule out.

quotes.race: Downpatrick Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Tell Nobody Nothin travelled great. He had a break over the summer and I'm thrilled with him. We'll take it steady, we'll look for a rated novice with him or something like that - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Your Honor
runners.comment: Out of depth on recent chase debut; this looks more realistic but quicker ground not ideal
runners.spotlight: Front-runner's two hurdle wins have been at Limerick in testing conditions; out of depth on recent chase debut at Navan (Grade 3) this looks more realistic but quicker ground not ideal.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Your Honor was so impressive when he won here on similar ground, and it was a fairly obvious move to come back here. He jumps so well and he seems to want genuinely heavy ground. I suppose we will have to go the spring festivals - James Nash, trainer

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services Hurdle
quotes.quote: Your Honor just seemed to be a different horse on that ground. We would hope that he's a Graded horse and we can look at Fairyhouse and Punchestown now - James Nash, trainer.

runners.name: True Testimony
runners.comment: Recent Clonmel run augurs well providing she handles these quicker conditions
runners.spotlight: Hit the crossbar in a couple of maiden hurdles last term on soft/heavy; similar conditions in two chase attempts last month, latter occasion when clear fourth in decent 2m4f Clonmel mares' beginners; unproven on this better ground.

runners.name: Asphalt Cowboy
runners.comment: 2-10 in points, fine effort in defeat in similar race to this latest, solid chance
runners.spotlight: Two-time point-to-point winner; ran a fine race on his Rules' debut at Thurles in a similar race to this on latest; the cheekpieces worn that day are retained; solid chance.

runners.name: Cosmic Blizzard
runners.comment: 1-6 in points, beat Drumcliff Bay on penultimate, can't discount with ground to suit
runners.spotlight: 1-6 in point-to-points; 0-7 in chases under Rules and rated 106; beat Drumcliff Bay by 0.75l on his penultimate start at Belharbour; another decent effort when third at Belclare latest; not discounted on ground that will suit.

runners.name: Drumcliff Bay
runners.comment: Closely matched with Cosmic Blizzard, has course form, cheekpieces & tongue tie go on
runners.spotlight: Was close up behind Cosmic Blizzard on his penultimate start off level weights; has run well here before over hurdles; could go well in first time tongue tie and cheekpieces.

runners.name: Last Round
runners.comment: Won on soft at Tinahely in January, held by Asphalt Cowboy latest, may need softer ground
runners.spotlight: Won a soft ground point-to-point at Tinahely in January after shaping with promise in a heavy ground maiden hurdle at Navan on debut; beaten 15l (11l behind Asphalt Cowboy) at Thurles in his first hunters chase; this ground may be on the quick side.

stable_tour.quote: He shaped nicely at Navan in a maiden hurdle and should be up to picking up a race. 28-10-24

runners.name: Step Up Son
runners.comment: 2-12 in points, fine effort at big odds latest at Gowran, big chance if handles the ground
runners.spotlight: 2-12 in point-to-points; outran odds of 100-1 at Gowran (3m1f, soft) earlier this month to finish second of 13, 6.5l behind the winner; unraced on ground with good in the description, big chance if he handles it.

runners.name: Cause For Comment
runners.comment: Promise in a Galway bumper and two points for Willie Mullins, new yard now, considered
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in a good ground Galway bumper on debut for Willie Mullins; beaten in two point-to-points on testing ground and has now joined Stephen Carey; return to better ground should suit and he is considered.

runners.name: Kingston Coole
runners.comment: Won a point in May 2024, pulled up last two starts, hood and tongue tie now tried
runners.spotlight: Won a mares' maiden point-to-point at Necarne in May 2024; pulled up on Rules' debut at Clonmel in January and similar outcome back in a point-to-point at Knockanard; first time hood and tongue tie needs to spark a revival.

runners.name: Townhill Lass
runners.comment: Won a maiden point last month, pulled up at Clonmel previously, more needed to win
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at sixth attempt in a maiden point-to-point on yielding ground at Comea last month; runner up has won since; pulled up sole start under Rules at Clonmel; needs more to win this.

2:00.race_name: "Look De Vega" At Ballylinch Stud Fillies Maiden

runners.name: Academe
runners.comment: Second foal, half-sister to the trainer's 7f/1m winner Serialise, dam 7f winner on debut
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to the trainer's 7f/1m winner Serialise; dam 7f winner for Joseph O'Brien on debut.

runners.name: Arctic Steps
runners.comment: Beaten 10l in sixth at Down Royal on only start for Jessica Harrington, plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Beaten 10l in sixth at Down Royal on only start for Jessica Harrington; plenty to find on stable debut.

runners.name: Crystal Ball
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Noteworthy as half-sister to the top-class Tepin who has become influential as a broodmare
runners.spotlight: Twelfth living foal; half-sister to five winners, notably the top-class Tepin, winner of 13 races including the Queen Anne and the Woodbine Mile, and now the dam of Group 1 winner Grateful and Ballysax candidate Delacroix; also a half-brother to Grade 2 winner Vyjack.

runners.name: Intensify
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Sister to Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf Fillies winner Newspaperofrecord, Classic-entered
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; sister to Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf Fillies winner Newspaperofrecord, sister to another winner and half-sister to three winners including the useful Classical Times; dam Group 3 winner by Holy Roman Emperor; Classic-entered filly deserves obvious respect.

runners.name: Made U Blush
runners.comment: Showed promise in two starts at two, open to improvement but probably vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Ran twice at two; hampered when fair fourth at Cork on debut; may have found 7f inadequate at Dundalk, not beaten far in sixth, open to improvement but probably vulnerable to one of the superbly-bred newcomers.

runners.name: Noli Timere
runners.comment: Never involved in the Goffs Million on only start at two, has had ample time to mature
runners.spotlight: Never involved in the Goffs Million on only start at two; has had ample time to mature.

runners.name: Tarima
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Aga Khan
runners.comment: Of major interest as a close relation to the brilliant Tarnawa, half-sister to Tahiyra
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega filly is of obvious interest as a close relation to her trainer's brilliant Tarnawa (Prix Vermeille, Prix de l'Opera, Breeders' Cup Turf), and half-sister to four-time Group 1 winner Tahiyra; dam, Listed winner by Cape Cross.

runners.name: Henri Matisse
runners.owner: Mrs J Magnier/M Tabor/D Smith/Merriebelle Irish Farm Ltd

prev_owners.owner: Mrs J Magnier/M Tabor/D Smith/Merriebelle Irish Farm Ltd
Mrs J Magnier/M Tabor/D Smith/Merriebelle Irish Farm Ltd
Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith & Merriebelle Irish Farm

runners.comment: Breeders' Cup Juvenile hero after a couple of high-profile lapses, can make his class tell
runners.spotlight: Beat subsequent Group 1 winners Hotazhell and Scorthy Champ in Group 2 Futurity at the Curragh; looked an awkward ride when failing to uphold form with Scorthy Champ in National Stakes; probably unsuited by soft ground when below form in Prix Jean-Luc Legardere; came good in style over 1m on quick ground at the Breeders' Cup.

quotes.race: Prevagen Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf (Grade 1) (2yo Colts, Geldings & Ridglings) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I said to Aidan beforehand I felt Henri Matisse was by far the best horse in the race. He just travelled into it and I was wide on the bend, but he took me there very comfortably. He won without even knowing he was in the race - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Wootton Bassett Irish EBF Futurity Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Henri Matisse is a lazy horse and he quickens. He was doing that over six and to show that over seven is a good sign. The National Stakes is the plan - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN Railway Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We thought Henri Matisse was a bit too babyish to go to Ascot and Wayne [Lordan, jockey] said he was still babyish there today, but that he will love going up to seven. We will see what we have for the Phoenix Stakes and we will see if we go up to seven next time. He's a lovely horse, though, he tries very hard and he has an unbelievable pedigree. That was my fault [when asked if he was surprised Moore had chosen Tunbridge Wells]. I thought he was a bit more forward and a bit hardier. It was hard to assess Henri Matisse after the first day. He made hard work of it and I put him on the wrong one. I would say the winner is a National Stakes horse. If he was to go again before that it would be the Phoenix Stakes or the Futurity. We haven't really leaned on the colts yet. Hopefully from here on they will really start arriving - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Tally Ho Stud Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Henri Matisse will improve a lot mentally. He's a lovely horse. He was very babyish and if he was going to go to Ascot he would need another run - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

runners.name: Arizona Blaze
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: Top-class juvenile sprinter, warmed up at Dundalk, big threat to Henri Matisse if he stays
runners.spotlight: Talented juvenile sprinter last year, winning the Group 3 Marble Hill Stakes at the Curragh and twice placed at top level, notably when second to fellow Irish raider Magnum Force at the Breeders' Cup on final start; warmed up for this with a comfortable odds-on win at Dundalk; a major threat to Henri Matisse if he stays.

quotes.race: Horse Racing Every Friday Until 11th April Race
quotes.quote: Lovely horse. Arizona Blaze Did nothing wrong last year and it was good to see him train on, I thought he looked a picture in the paddock, he's done well physically. He was always a big horse that was going to be better at three, hopefully he does that. There's only one Guineas and if he's going to stay a mile we'll have to try. If he doesn't stay he can always drop back to 6f - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Norfolk Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Arizona Blaze has run really good. He's versatile ground-wise. Five furlongs on quick ground is probably the sharpest he would want. Really proud of him, he ran a great race - David Egan, jockey.

quotes.race: GAIN Marble Hill Stakes (In Memory Of Theresa Marnane) (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Arizona Blaze was a bit keen early but after a furlong he relaxed and he saw out the trip well. He's learning all the time and he showed a lot more speed here on this quicker ground - David Egan, rider.

quotes.race: Castle Star And Alkumait At Capital Stud Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Arizona Blaze is a very nice horse with loads of improvement and hopefully we can build on this. The further he went the better he got. We will be aiming to go to Royal Ascot and we will see where we go in the meantime. He will improve on better ground - Adrian Murray, trainer.

runners.name: Comanche Brave
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Mrs A M Obrien
runners.comment: Listed-placed, soundly beaten on soft ground over C&D in the Group 3 Killavullan Stakes
runners.spotlight: Big step forward from debut when bolting up on fast ground in a 6f maiden at Cork last September; stuck to his task well when second in a 7f Listed race at Dundalk; soundly beaten on soft ground over C&D in the Group 3 Killavullan Stakes.

runners.name: Hazdann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Aga Khan
runners.comment: 7f Curragh maiden winner, form well advertised by runner-up Green Impact, smart prospect
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and got no run on debut at Gowran last June; showed notable promise in winning a maiden over this trip at the Curragh later that month; form well advertised by runner-up Green Impact in winning a Group 2 event at this venue; smart prospect.

quotes.race: Barronstown Stud Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Hazdann got no run at Gowran but he came home well and has progressed well since. He learned a lot that day and Chris used his experience. He's a lovely colt and will probably go for a stakes race next - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Rock Of Cashel
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Aimed high after his Galway festival maiden win, safely held by stablemate Henri Matisse;
runners.spotlight: Aimed high after his Galway festival maiden win; safely held by stablemate Henri Matisse on Futurity and National Stakes running; last of five in the Dewhurst on final start

runners.name: Spycraft
runners.breeder: S A R L De Chambure Haras D'Etreham,Gestut Zur Kuste Ag,S A
runners.comment: Has a decent future judged on debut win at Dundalk but this is very demanding
runners.spotlight: Cost 310,000gns as a yearling; has a decent future judged on debut win at Dundalk, but this is very demanding considering his relative inexperience.

runners.name: Tribal Nation
runners.owner: Teme Valley & Newsells Park Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Rated 90 after Galway maiden win on his third start, hard to fancy at this level
runners.spotlight: Rated 90 after Galway maiden win on his third start; runner-up remains a maiden; hard to fancy at this level.

quotes.race: Corrib Maiden
quotes.quote: He travelled well, quickened up really well and had a little look when I got there but Tribal Nation is a gorgeous horse. I was a bit far back the last day in Gowran and had a lot of ground to make up but coming back to seven furlongs suited him today. He showed a good attitude on the ground in the last furlong and I think he is a nice horse who will only get better - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Bubbling
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Signed off last season with victory in the Group 2 Rockfel Stakes, small penalty
runners.spotlight: Suffered two defeats at this venue last season, including when fourth behind stablemate Exactly on debut; good winner of a maiden at Galway and signed off last with victory in the Group 2 Rockfel Stakes; has a 3lb penalty; Ryan Moore prefers Exactly.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Rockfel Stakes (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We were delighted with Bubbling as she was a bit unlucky at Leopardstown last time. She obviously handles easy ground but I don't think she'll run again this year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Barnavara
runners.comment: Solid placed form at Pattern level last year, needs to find extra to win in this grade
runners.spotlight: Solid placed form at Pattern level last year; needs to find extra to win in this grade, though worth noting she is closely matched with Exactly on their running behind Bedtime Story at this venue.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Barnavara was good. We worked her on softish ground the other day and I was delighted with her. She will probably like better ground. We might go to Ascot for the Albany and she might have a run before then - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

runners.name: Carla Ridge
runners.comment: Took a huge step forward from her debut when a 100-1 maiden winner at Naas, big task here
runners.spotlight: Took a huge step forward from her debut when a 100-1 maiden winner at Naas in September; big task here.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Carla Ridge is a filly we loved from the day we bought her. She was a bit disappointing at the Curragh but she did today what we hoped she might be capable of and showed that she could be a stakes filly - Patrick Harty, joint trainer.

runners.name: Cercene

prev_owners.owner: Shane R Stafford/J C Fleming/Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd
J C Fleming & Crampscastle Bloodstock Ltd

runners.comment: Naas maiden winner, failed to cope with the rise in class in a 1m Group 3 at the Curragh
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut at Gowran in July; Naas maiden winner on second outings; failed to cope with the rise in class in a 1m Group 3 at the Curragh.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden
quotes.quote: Circene looked to be going nowhere and then won well. We think she's a very good filly. The Park Stakes might come a bit soon for her, but she is in the EBF Final here in the autumn, but she might be finished for this year - Joe Murphy junior, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Copacabana Sands
runners.comment: Has run several good races in defeat, unlikely to make the breakthrough in this company
runners.spotlight: Has run several good races in defeat, and has a run under her belt this season; 85-rated filly is unlikely to make the breakthrough in this company.

runners.name: Exactly
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Very experienced, twice placed at Group 1 level, impressed over C&D on soft on final start
runners.spotlight: Very experienced; twice third at Group 1 level, in the Moyglare and the Prix Marcel Boussac, outperforming her shorter-priced stablemate Bedtime Story in the big French event; impressed in making all in a Group 3 event over C&D on soft on final start; Ryan Moore's pick in line with official and RPR figures.

quotes.race: Killavullan Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I've always thought Exactly was a very straightforward filly and she hasn't put a foot wrong all year. She's been meeting Bedtime Story and Lake Victoria, so she's done nothing wrong. She's got a lovely mind and she's very easy to do anything with. Every day when you ride her, she just does her usual routine and saves it all for the track. She has a turn of foot and I would say a mile is her trip at the moment anyway - Wayne Lordan, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Exactly stuck her head out and really tried. She's going to be a lovely filly for the second half of the year and might go for a race like the Debutante or the Flame Of Tara - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

runners.name: Merrily
runners.breeder: Lynch Bages Ltd & Camas Park Stud
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: 5f maiden winner, saw out this trip well when winning a Group 3 at Newmarket in October
runners.spotlight: 5f winner at Naas last June and third in the 7f Prestige Stakes at Goodwood; finished behind Barnavara when fifth in the Debutante Stakes; saw out this trip well when winning a Group 3 at Newmarket in October.

quotes.race: Dooley Insurance Group Irish EBF Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Merrily had a lovely run down in Listowel the first time but was a bit slow to jump and Wayne felt that she was a bit unlucky as she got squeezed at the wrong time. This isn't her ideal trip but the race presented itself. We thought we'd give it a go and it worked out - Chris Armstrong, stable representative

runners.name: Minaun View
runners.comment: Made her debut in a Listed race at Dundalk so clearly well regarded, up against it here
runners.spotlight: Made her debut in a Listed race at Dundalk so clearly well regarded; up against it here.

runners.name: Miracle Beauty
runners.comment: Earned a relatively low official rating (85) in her two races, much to prove at this level
runners.spotlight: Earned a relatively low official rating (85) in two Naas races; useful prospect but has much to prove at this level.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Miracle Beauty is still very raw and a big baby. She travelled well for the first half but she's still learning and will be a nice filly next year - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey.

runners.name: Orchidaceae

prev_owners.owner: Team Valor International LLC & A Oliver

runners.comment: Backed up a Curragh maiden win with C&D success last June, might prefer better ground
runners.spotlight: Backed up a Curragh maiden win with C&D success last June; did not appear again and might prefer better ground for her reappearance; worth a look for future reference.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Orchidaceae won well at the Curragh so we were quite hopeful coming here. Everything went to plan and it was very straightforward. She loves that ground and we will have to look at stepping her up in grade - Andy Oliver, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Orchidaceae is one that Andy liked and he thought if I got a bit of cover today she might come home well. I would have no problem going another furlong - Andy Slattery, rider

runners.name: Sparkling Sea
runners.comment: Good early-season juvenile, form linked to the Albany Stakes winner, off since last May
runners.spotlight: Made a winning debut in a 6f maiden at Naas last April, failed to confirm form with the runner-up Fairy Godmother in a Group 3 over the same course and trip in May; no disgrace in that, since the winner captured the Albany Stakes at Royal Ascot; long absence to overcome.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: In her last couple of pieces of work Sparkling Sea is coming to hand. I'd say she's only going to get quicker with racing and I'd say you'll see a better filly on a nicer surface. She looks like a proper two-year-old, she's a good ball of a filly, and mentally she's very straightforward. Hopefully she can build on today and keep going forward - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Swelter
runners.comment: 1m maiden course winner on only juvenile start, may have enough pace to be competitive
runners.spotlight: Made a winning introduction over 1m at this venue last July; did not appear again; interesting that she is dropped in trip here; may have sufficient pace to cope, since her superbly bred dam (half-sister to Midday) won the Nell Gywn.

runners.name: Usdi Atohi
runners.comment: Both juvenile wins were at 5f, Group 3 runner-up at 6f, perhaps more of a sprinting type
runners.spotlight: Two wins, including a 5f Listed event at Tipperar; respectable display when fifth in the Molecomb at Goodwood; confirmed a good standard of form when second to the odds-on Ides Of March in a Group 3 over 6f at the Curragh; not sure to be as effective at 7f; hooded.

runners.name: Delacroix
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Sets the standard on last year's form, narrowly denied by Hotazhell in the Futurity
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 1m6f Group 1 winner Grateful; never worse than second five starts at two; twice runner-up at this track, including in a four-runner 1m Group 2 before winning the 1m Group 3 Autumn Stakes at Newmarket; clear of the remainder when narrowly denied by Jessica Harrington's Hotazhell in the Futurity at Doncaster; handled soft then.

quotes.race: William Hill Futurity Trophy Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Delacroix has run a stormer. We hope that bodes well for next year - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Emirates Autumn Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Delacroix is a lovely horse and Ryan said he won with a bit in hand. With his pedigree there's no reason why he can't make up into a nice middle-distance prospect for next year - Paul Smith, representing the owners.

quotes.race: Trainor Stone And Tile Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Delacroix was very green the first day and he was still very green here. He was babyish in the stalls and he will come forward again - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Kibris
runners.breeder: Hussain Alabbas Lootah&lope De Vega Synd
runners.comment: Won 27-runner 1m maiden first time out at the Curragh, apparent second-string for trainer
runners.spotlight: Cost 155,000euros as a yearling; coped with soft ground and looked potentially useful when winning a 27-runner 1m maiden first time out at the Curragh last November; winning rider is aboard Wemightakedlongway now.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Kibris is a gorgeous big horse. The race set up lovely for him, he travelled well and was very professional. He picked up better than I thought. He has plenty about him and is one to look forward to - Dylan Browne McMonagle, rider.

runners.name: Lambourn
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Won a Listed race in France, failed to feature when last of five in the Beresford Stakes
runners.spotlight: Fortunate (clear leader ran out close home) debut winner at Killarney last July; improved on that to win a 1m Listed race at Craon on soft ground, despite missing the break and racing a bit lazily; failed to raise his game when last of five in the Beresford Stakes.

runners.name: Puppet Master
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Failed to boost Classic claims when fourth behind Wimbledon Hawkeye in the Royal Lodge
runners.spotlight: Second on debut at Killarney last July; odds-on when landing a Galway festival maiden on soft; failed to boost Classic claims when fourth of seven behind Wimbledon Hawkeye in the Royal Lodge; plenty of speed on the dam's side, but Camelot can supply the stamina required for this.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back If 2nd To SP Fav Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Puppet Master is a lovely colt. He had a lovely run at Killarney, running green but finishing out well. Today he was very professional. He jumped, travelled, and I thought he quickened up well. He had a look when he got there but he went to the line well and he has a bit of class - Wayne Lordan, rider.

runners.name: Tiberius Thunder
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Strongly supported when making a winning debut in a 1m maiden at Dundalk, should stay
runners.spotlight: Cost 220,000gns as a yearling; second foal; dam won the 7f Group 3 Weld Park Stakes; strongly supported odds-on favourite when making a winning debut a 1m maiden at Dundalk last month; left an impression he will get this trip.

quotes.race: Put The Fun In Fundraising At Dundalk Maiden
quotes.quote: Tiberius Thunder was greener than I thought he would be but he hit the line nice. He will improve plenty and he will stay further - Wayne Lordan, rider.

runners.name: Spicy Margarita
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Not guaranteed to stay on pedigree and might prefer better ground; stable's second-string.
runners.spotlight: Midfield on heavy at Galway on debut last October; useful form at Dundalk, landing a 7f maiden last month; second in a 1m conditions event earlier this month; not guaranteed to stay on pedigree and might prefer better ground; stable's second-string.

runners.name: Wemightakedlongway
runners.comment: Did not quite meet expectations when third in a 1m1f Group 3 event here last October
runners.spotlight: Showed promise (met trouble in running) in a 1m fillies' maiden at Cork on debut; made almost all at the same venue on second attempt, getting the better of a Ballydoyle-trained favourite and subsequent winner; did not quite meet expectations when third behind a long-priced stablemate in a 1m1f Group 3 event here in October.

runners.name: Glen To Glen
runners.comment: Long-priced Curragh maiden winner for this rider, plenty of weight, 10lb claim will help
runners.spotlight: Ran twice over 1m at two; long-priced Curragh 6f maiden winner for this rider on return; plenty of weight, 10lb claim will help.

quotes.race: Tote.ie Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: His last run wasn't too bad, although I thought six furlongs might be a little short for Glen To Glen. He's fairly straightforward, a suitable apprentice ride especially one claiming 10lb. She did it well - Jim Bolger, trainer

runners.name: Galveston
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier/Michael Tabor/Derrick Smith/Peter M Brant
runners.comment: Flopped on debut at Naas, made amends at same venue on second start, one of stable trio
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt; cost 2,000,000gns as a yearling; odds-on, dropped away to finish last of seven on debut in a 7f maiden at Naas in September; confirmed that was too bad to be true when making amends at the same venue on second start; Ryan Moore on Serious Contender but chance should not be discounted.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Galveston is a big, strong colt and he was very good from the gates today. He's travelled around plenty idle and green and raw, so he will come on from it. He's had to do the donkey work the whole way and he was never headed. It's a long way up the straight here and the ground has gone a bit testing for two-year-olds too. He was probably always looking for a little bit of company. My lad is tough and when something came to him he's gone on again - Gavin Ryan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Lady O
runners.comment: Now 12lb higher than when winning a Galway nursery, highly tried on final start
runners.spotlight: Roscommon maiden winner on debut before two good runs in defeat; made light of an opening mark of 75 in a Galway festival nursery; highly tried in a Group 3 event on final start; 12lb higher than for her win.

quotes.race: Whiriskey Refrigeration Irish EBF Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lady O had won on soft and she really relished the ground and the stiff uphill finish. She is going to be a middle-distance filly for next year and we just love her - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: That was absolutely lovely because Lady O is named after Lady O'Reilly who was in the syndicate and she actually bred her. We bought her a couple of weeks after she passed away. Being by Australia we didn't think she'd be out this early but she's just done everything so easily and she was ready to start today. Shane (Foley) said she wasn't in love with the ground and she's only going to keep stepping forward - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Mister Adam
runners.comment: No doubts about fitness having made the frame in maidens at Dundalk and the Curragh
runners.spotlight: Dam won the Irish St Leger; fine effort on debut when fourth in a 27-runner 1m Curragh maiden won by Ballysax hopeful Kibris; below that level at Dundalk in January; again shaped well when a staying-on third over 1m at the Curragh two weeks; appeals as  a lively each-way option.

runners.name: Serious Contender
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Course maiden winner over 1m, Ryan Moore's pick from a choice of three, obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Looked in need of the run and further when fourth in a Naas maiden on debut; improved when pulling clear with his main market rival to finish runner-up in a Tipperary maiden second time out; workmanlike course maiden winner over on final start; Ryan Moore's pick from a choice of three; obvious chance.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Even with the two runs under his belt Wayne [Lordan] felt Serious Contender was very babyish. It's a good sign that there's plenty left in there. He's a horse that stays very well and he'd be one to bring back for a Derby trial but you wouldn't be surprised if he even stepped up a bit further and would be a lovely staying horse for next year - Chris Armstrong, representing trainer Aidan O'Brien

runners.name: Just Before
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Won a 7f maiden at this venue on soft, failed to feature when raised in trip at Dundalk
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f maiden on soft ground at this venue last October; failed to feature when raised in trip at Dundalk.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: I was shocked when the handicapper gave Just Before a mark of 74 and disappointed. I thought she was better than that and she obviously is - Willie Browne, trainer

runners.name: Dahlia Noir
runners.comment: Showed promise in maidens at this venue, sights lowered after Listed bid last August
runners.spotlight: Decent level of form in three maiden outings, two of them at this venue, including on debut behind subsequent National Stakes winner Scorthy Champ;  sights lowered after Listed bid on final start at two.

runners.name: Light As Air
runners.owner: M Matsushima & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith
runners.comment: Half-brother to St Leger winner Continuous, has run only twice and is open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to St Leger winner Continuous;  has run only twice, placed both times at 1m; open to improvement now that he steps up in trip and helps to give top stable a strong hand; good 5lb claimer.

runners.name: Berto Ramirez
runners.comment: Failed to build on his second in a 7f maiden at this venue last August, handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Second in an 18-runner maiden over 7f here in August; respectable sixth of 14 from a wide draw at Down Royal; mixed signals from his Dundalk runs; handicap debut.

runners.name: Sunriseontheboyne
runners.comment: Strong recent form at Dundalk, has won on soft, needs to prove stamina for this trip
runners.spotlight: Turf winner last year; has prospered during the winter, winning three of his races at Dundalk, two of them this month; Killarney win was on soft, needs to prove he has the stamina for this trip.

runners.name: Ill Be Handy
runners.comment: Massive improvement needed, takes a big step up in trip after last of 13 over 6f
runners.spotlight: Massive improvement needed, takes a big step up in trip after last of 13 over 6f at the Curragh on seasonal debut.

runners.name: Sugar Club
runners.comment: Won a maiden over 1m at Bellewstown, not as effective over shorter trips subsequently
runners.spotlight: Fair third in a 7f maiden here on debut; winning favourite in a maiden over 1m at Bellewstown last July; not as effective over shorter trips subsequently.

runners.name: Mocking
runners.comment: Can be given some sort of chance based on his fifth behind today's rival Galveston at Naas
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in maidens over this trip at the Curragh and Punchestown on his first two starts; can be given some sort of chance based on his fifth behind today's rival Galveston at Naas; has been gelded.

runners.name: You Are Mine
runners.comment: Outran her 33-1 odds when third over 1m at Dundalk on handicap debut, modest turf form
runners.spotlight: Better of three maiden runs when remote third behind two useful colts over 1m1f at Tipperary; outran her 33-1 odds when third over 1m at Dundalk on handicap debut.

runners.name: Birdie Time
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Her Majesty The Queen
runners.owner: Omega & Monmouth Bay Racing Llc & Tom Galway
runners.comment: Hard to make a case for her and the stable has a more obvious contender in Lady O
runners.spotlight: Ran three times in maidens last autumn; hard to make a case for her, and the stable has a more obvious contender in Lady O.

runners.name: Flynn Ryder
runners.comment: Some merit in his Dundalk form, needs to prove stamina and ability to handle an ease
runners.spotlight: Some merit in his Dundalk form at 6f/7f/1m; needs to prove stamina and ability to handle an ease.

runners.name: Georg Zhukov
runners.comment: Hampered on debut, respectable second at Thurles, Dundalk form not as encouraging
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite for his debut at Roscommon, suffered interference and was eased when beaten; Thurles second was respectable, though soundly beaten; Dundalk form not as encouraging.

runners.name: Bucaneers Spirit
runners.comment: Two-time winner at 1m on nice ground, fit from AW, 4lb above last win, poorly drawn
runners.spotlight: 2-5 on turf, both wins coming over 1m on good-good to firm; fit from the AW; 4lb above last winning mark but could resume progress returned to turf, though has a very wide draw to overcome.

runners.name: Derry Lad
runners.comment: 4-26, new yard, last won in June 2023, lacks a run, probably best watched unless backed
runners.spotlight: 4-26 for Kevin Coleman; last won at Pontefract off 77 in June 2023; has since failed to make an impact off his revised mark and has moved to Emmet Mullins; lacks a run and probably best watched unless the money comes.

runners.name: Artful Approach
runners.comment: Won at Galway last year, ran well here last June in cheekpieces, chance for in form yard
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f at Galway (yielding) in July for Jack Davison off 73; good run off 7lb higher at the same venue six days later on heavy (8.5f); ran well on good ground here last June in cheekpieces and they are back on today; new yard is in form and he makes the shortlist.

runners.name: Expound
runners.comment: 2-14 on turf on the Flat, jockey claims 10lb, has gone well fresh, place chance
runners.spotlight: Dual purpose; 2-14 on turf on the Flat; second of 11 off this mark on latest start in this sphere last September; off since below par run over hurdles at Tipperary in October; has gone well fresh before and jockey takes off 10lb; place chance.

quotes.race: Peter Queally Memorial Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Expound has plenty of ability and it's good the way he can mix it between both [codes]. When he won his [Flat] maiden he made the running and Denis [Hogan, trainer] said to keep it simple, he likes to make the running and let the horses try and catch him. He was very good from the front, jumped really well and travelled and when they came to him he picked up and done it nicely in the end - Daniel King, jockey, speaking to RTV.

runners.name: Counterculture
runners.comment: 1-7, poorly drawn, sole win came on heavy, may need softer ground and lacks a run
runners.spotlight: 1-7 on turf, the win coming on heavy ground in a 7.5f Roscommon fillies' maiden; ran respectably here over 1m2f (heavy) on handicap debut when last seen in October and dropped 1lb; poorly drawn, lacks a recent run and may need softer ground.

quotes.race: Murray Ambulance Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Counterculture did it all on her own and her last 100yds were her best. She is getting sharper every run. She is a big strong mare and she gets through that sort of ground well - Willie McCreery, trainer.

runners.name: Migdam
runners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

prev_owners.owner: Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley T'breds & Shamrock T'breds & B T O'Sullivan
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

runners.comment: Sole win on turf off 89 in June 2022, 15lb lower now, well drawn, racefit, interesting
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner but three of those wins have come on the AW; sole turf win came off 89 at Doncaster (1m2f, good) in June 2022 and rated 15lb lower now; nicely drawn, is racefit and well-handicapped on his old form; interesting.

runners.name: Mythical Rock
runners.comment: 0-8 on turf but has run well in defeat, placed off 3lb higher at Galway, can't discount
runners.spotlight: Maiden is 0-8 on turf but has run well in defeat; good effort on debut for this yard in a 1m Dundalk maiden last month but disappointed in a handicap back there latest; should do better returned to turf and ran well at Galway off 3lb higher in October; not discounted.

runners.name: Zipster
runners.comment: Won off 69 at Yarmouth last May, may have needed latest on stable bow, well drawn, claims
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m Yarmouth handicap on good for Simon and Ed Crisford off 69 last May; won off 70 at Southwell in August; poor effort on debut for Ger O'Leary at Dundalk but was slowly away and may have needed the run; should come on for that and he's well drawn here; claims.

runners.name: Abbey Actress
runners.owner: J P M Oconnor & Paul J Nolan & Nora Odonoghue
runners.comment: Won at Killarney off 66, drying ground a query, lacks a run, wide draw, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in second handicap at Killarney (1m3f) on bottomless ground last October off 66; probably didn't stay 1m4f when last seen at Gowran; top jockey booked but drying ground would raise questions, she lacks a run and she's drawn wide; others appeal more.

runners.name: Super Exceed
runners.comment: 1m maiden winner at Naas on good, no impact yet in h'caps, drawn wide, lacks a run, watch
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in a 1m maiden on good ground at Naas last August; no impact in two handicaps over this C&D the next twice and reportedly stopped quickly when last seen at Dundalk in November; the hood worn that day is discarded; probably best watched from wide draw.

quotes.race: ALTO EQUINE Building Solutions Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: We always thought a bit of Super Exceed and she's only learning. She had the maestro on board and I was delighted to have him. I love his experience and his way with fillies. He was impressed with her because she was too far back and she was wheel-spinning on the ground there a bit - Tom Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Dark Viper
runners.comment: 0-13 on turf, fine effort on return, this trip fine, Foley keeps faith, drawn low, chance
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; 0-13 on turf but has finished second on seven occasions, including on seasonal reappearance at the Curragh (6f, soft) two weeks ago off 2lb lower; has run well over this trip, Foley keeps the faith and he has a low draw; leading claims.

runners.name: Encosta
runners.comment: Course winner over 10f, form figures of 32331 at this venue, wide draw but can't discount
runners.spotlight: 2-16 on turf; her last win came at this venue in May 2024 over 1m2f (good) off 68 and she's just 3lb higher now; has won on yielding to soft; Keane was on board for that last win and he's back in the plate today; course form figures of 32331; drawn poorly and lacks a run but she can't be discounted.

runners.name: Rampage
runners.owner: Mrs P Mccourt/Whytes Stamullen Syndicate/S Sweeney
runners.comment: Has won here over 1m1f, ground versatile, fit from the AW, draw not ideal, place claims
runners.spotlight: 2-28 on turf; one of those wins came here over 1m1f on good ground; has also won on soft; likes it here, is fit from the AW and he was second off this mark at Bellewstown in October; draw is not ideal but he has place claims.

quotes.race: James P. Cunningham Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: The stiffer track suited Rampage today. We were a bit worried about the ground but he showed us he is well able for it. We took a while to get to know him but he seems to be in a good vein of form. He was due his head in front again. It opened up well for me, he got the splits at the right time and when he gets there he just does enough - James Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Chavajod
runners.owner: D P Coakley & J F Costello & A Connick & P Coakley
runners.comment: C&D winner off 1lb lower, had a sharpener at Dundalk, David Egan booked, could go well
runners.spotlight: 2-21 on turf, his last win coming over this C&D in May 2023 off 68; just 1lb higher now and shaped with promise on the AW on latest on his return from a break; draw is not the best but he could go well with David Egan an interesting booking.

runners.name: Neo Smart
runners.comment: AW winner, 0-14 on turf, best form on soft, improve for latest, rain would enhance chance
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 0-14 on turf; best efforts have come on rain softened ground; should come on for her seasonal reappearance at the Curragh two weeks ago and is well handicapped on her 4l third off 77 at that venue last May; yard has started the season well; chance, especially if it rains.

quotes.race: View Restaurant At Dundalk Stadium Median Auction Maiden (Div II)
quotes.quote: We didn't go very fast early. Neo Smart picked up nice into the straight. The second horse headed her but to be fair she was only getting going to the line. She handled the surface well - Rory Cleary, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Thrifty Of Digby
runners.comment: Gowran winner off 6lb lower, Foley prefers her stablemate, probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; gained first win off 61 at Gowran in October (soft to heavy) and 6lb higher here; Foley rode that day and he prefers her stablemate; probably best watched.

runners.name: Church Mountain
runners.comment: Six time winner, out of form at Dundalk, no win on turf since July 2023, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; six time winner, including four on turf; last two wins have come on the AW at 10.5f; has been out of form at that venue recently; hasn't won on grass since July 2023; not badly drawn but others make more appeal.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain has taken a while to come around to our way of thinking but we got him started at Leopardstown a couple of weeks ago and ran a lovely race. It gave us confidence to drop him in because he's won his other races for Denis Hogan making it. He looked like he won snug enough at the line so hopefully he'll be able to go to Galway and be competitive - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Limerick Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: You'd call stall 18 a bad draw usually, but not with Church Mountain because he doesn't like traffic around him. If he's drawn low and misses the break, it can be hard for him to get going, but Dan is super value for his 7lb claim off those weights. This horse has won twice at Galway and hopefully will go back there. Even though he's a big horse, he seems to like good ground - Denis Hogan, trainer

quotes.race: James P. Cunningham Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain picked up well and did everything for me today. I'd say he's going to make a lovely dual purpose horse, he won't be a horse until next year - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

quotes.race: Kenny Galway Volvo Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain is one we always liked, but he's a massive horse and still not the finished article. He was green in front but he needed to be there because he is a 1m2f horse. Making the running was the making of him - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Dont Do Dramas
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: 3-18 on turf, 1lb below last win, lacks a run and is poorly drawn, probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 3-18 on turf; won off 1lb higher at Ballinrobe last July over 9.5f (soft); might need this after a 160 day break and is poorly drawn; watch.

quotes.race: Guarantee Available On Course & Tote.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Making the running seems to work for Don't Do Dramas. We would try him over a mile and a half again. It's a good stiff uphill finish here and he wasn't stopping. He handles soft ground well but I think he'll go on most ground, he mightn't want it firm - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: That was probably Dont Do Dramas ideal conditions out there. He would probably get a little bit further in time. He is learning on the job and seems to be improving. Billy said he was a willing partner and really put his shoulder to the wheel. There is a nursery coming up in Galway for him that we won last year with Duke Of Leggagh - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

runners.name: Maharajjah
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, promise in maidens at Dundalk, struggled on turf, watch on stable bow
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; promise in a couple of maidens at 7f-1m at Dundalk but struggled on all three turf starts on a variety of ground; nicely drawn but best watched on debut for new yard.

runners.name: Sub Rosa
runners.comment: Promise in 2023 for Roger Varian, showed nothing for this yard last year, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in a couple of maidens in 2023 for Roger Varian; not much promise in four outings for this yard last season; difficult to make a case for.

runners.name: La La Lucrative
runners.comment: 6f winner on heavy off 4lb lower in the UK, beaten 37l on stable debut, watch; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; won over 6f on heavy ground off 59 on his final start for Gemma Tutty; beaten 37l on debut for this yard at the Curragh two weeks ago, racing keenly; best watched for now.

stable_tour.quote: He's taken some time to come together mentally. He's a bit of a sensitive soul. He ran three times last year, finishing third twice in small fields. We started him back at 5f this year at Beverley, where he was still learning, and have stepped him up to 6f for his next run, which will be at Catterick on Thursday. 23-05-24

runners.name: Starting Monday
runners.comment: 2-34 on turf, went close off 1lb higher on return here last April, could go well; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 2-34 on turf; finished off last season with decent efforts at Killarney and the Curragh; went close off 62 on seasonal reappearance here last year and 1lb lower now; could go well if getting a run.

quotes.race: Corrib Food Products Maiden
quotes.quote: He's been unlucky in some of his handicap runs when things didn't go his way, and a few days he didn't jump, but Billy [Lee] gave him a great ride and he said he's gotten more professional with his races. We'll see how he comes out of this before deciding whether he'll run again this season. We might step him up in trip, that probably would be the plan - Gillian Scott, trainer of Starting Monday

5:30.race_name: Sunday 11th May Leopardstown Family Day Handicap

runners.name: Brains
runners.comment: 11 time AW winner, 2-21 on turf, ran well here off much higher mark last June, chance
runners.spotlight: Heavily raced eleven time AW winner is 2-21 on turf, the last win coming in May 2024 off 72 at Roscommon (7.5f, soft); 12lb lower now and ran well here off 80 over 7f last June; chance.

quotes.race: www.roscommonracecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: I got a lovely easy lead which I didn't think I would, there was plenty of pace on paper. I got a nice breather into Brains around the bend and he stayed at it well. The slower ground over this shorter trip definitely helped today - Adam Caffrey, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Latin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: 0-11 on turf, best effort a neck second in claimer last July, wide draw, others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-11 on turf; best effort a neck second of 11 in a 1m2f Fairyhouse claimer last July; handicapper giving him a chance but he's poorly drawn here; others preferred.

runners.name: Si Senior
runners.comment: Beaten 4l over 7f off 8lb higher here last August, hood and tongue tie go on, chance
runners.spotlight: 1-10 on turf, the win coming in a 5.5f soft ground Sligo maiden in August 2023; has been running okay at Dundalk at 1m-10.5f; shaped with promise when beaten just 4l off 67 over 7f here in August of last year; claims if repeating that off 8lb lower; hood and tongue tie go on.

runners.name: Eastern Wind
runners.comment: Dual course winner, won off 3lb higher at Bellewstown last October, nice draw, go well
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner, including over C&D, but those wins came in 2022 and 2023; regained the winning thread off 61 at Bellewstown last October and is 3lb lower now; was running well when brought down over hurdles at Navan early this month; nicely drawn and could go well.

quotes.race: Sign Up For The Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle August 27th Handicap
quotes.quote: Eastern Wind was very gutsy. James gave her a good ride. She has to be in front and she will battle away if she is - Tom McCourt, trainer.

runners.name: Genuine Jim
runners.comment: Big hike for Curragh win off basement mark, beaten 6.5l in follow up bid, watch on return
runners.spotlight: Won off basement mark at the Curragh (7f, yielding to soft) in October when well backed; hiked 17lb for that and beaten 6.5l in follow up attempt over the same C&D; best form is at 7f, lacks a run and probably best watched on this occasion.

runners.name: Mogwli
runners.comment: Beat Eastern Wind when last winning at Bellewstown, goes well fresh, could outrun odds
runners.spotlight: Admirable veteran will be having his eighty first career start today; 6-77 on turf, his last win coming off 56 for this rider at Bellewstown (Eastern Wind second); goes well fresh, on a competitive mark and he isn't badly drawn; could outrun his odds.

quotes.race: Barney Curley Charity Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli took me there once I was able to take my time on him. Once I got past the horse in front he was able to pick up - Wesley Joyce, rider

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli broke well, there is lovely fresh ground on that rail and Jack just kept him happy. The horse fought them off well too - Willie McCreery, trainer.

quotes.race: TRM Hoofmaker Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli doesn't like the wind and having it behind him was the best thing for him. He rode a grand race and I loved the way he fought back at the finish - Willie McCreery, trainer.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse.ie Handicap
quotes.quote: Mogwli was bred by my wife. He's a tough and hardy little fellow and he loves racing. He'll be kept on the go for the apprentices to ride - Willie McCreery, trainer

runners.name: An Laochmor
runners.comment: Improved on h'cap debut on AW over 7f, well-drawn, step up to 1m needs to eke out more
runners.spotlight: Not much promise at big odds in three maidens; slightly better on handicap debut at Dundalk in February when beaten 6.25l over 7f; well-drawn here but the step up to 1m needs to eke out more.

runners.name: Asisaid
runners.owner: J Leigh & J Orourke & Teresa Leigh & Jenny Curley
runners.comment: 2-21 on turf, has won here over 7f, 4lb below last win, poorly drawn, rain would help
runners.spotlight: 2-21 on turf, his last win coming off 60 at Navan (1m, soft) in July 2023; not beaten far off this mark at Roscommon last October; fit from hurdling and he's won here before over 7f; badly drawn but if it rains he could run well.

quotes.race: O'Neill & Co. Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Asisaid got his ground today and the blinkers helped. When he goes and does it he has plenty of ability. With the ground as it is we might go to Galway - Pat Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: ITBA Next Generation Handicap
quotes.quote: Asisaid was a bit backward physically and mentally. We're delighted with that, we knew he'd do a job but we just didn't think he do it as quickly. He came to hand very quick this year - Pat Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Storm Eric
runners.comment: 0-16 on turf, ran well here off 1lb higher last May on good ground, chance if track dries
runners.spotlight: Three time AW winner is 0-16 on turf; one of his better efforts on grass came on good ground over C&D off 55 in May of last year when he was beaten 3.25l; place chance on that run if the track dries out.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Storm Eric works on his own at the beach and I use Jim Dreaper's gallops as well. I tip away and do it for the craic. It's great to get a day like this. He loves it here, so we'll keep coming. I have his half-sister broken and riding away, so hopefully she can win a couple of races - Jamie Flynn, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Master Garvey
runners.owner: Patrick M Obrien/Larry Murray/Richard W Walsh/Derek Cummins
runners.comment: Won at Dundalk latest, Hayes keeps faith, handles most ground, needs luck from draw
runners.spotlight: Arrives here on the back of an AW win over 1m off 47; has won on turf on heavy off 51 and is 2lb higher now; handles most ground, Chris Hayes maintains the partnership and he's in form but he'll need luck from his wide draw.

runners.name: Seas And Oceans
runners.comment: Placed off this mark at Killarney in 2024, Lordan on board, has had a run, interesting
runners.spotlight: Thirteen race maiden is 0-8 on turf; ran well over this trip at Killarney off 50 in August and again over 7f at Listowel off 51 the following month; has had a sharpener at Dundalk and Lordan is back on board; interesting.

runners.name: Browned Off
runners.comment: Handicap debutante, no impact in AW maidens, could improve for turf, check the market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; showed little at long odds in a trio of Dundalk maidens; could improve for switch to turf; check the market.

runners.name: Top Of The Pops
runners.comment: Lost form since debut win, no sign of revival for current yard, hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Lost way after debut win at Leicester (1m, heavy) for Mark and Charlie Johnston in 2020; no signs of a revival in six starts for this stable after a mammoth absence; hard to fancy on recent form.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Reference Point Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Top Of The Pops was really determined to win. He battled very well and was quite impressive on this heavy ground. He's a typical horse from Mark Johnston's stable - once he got his head in front he just kept fighting. He was very professional and the further he goes, the better he will be - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

runners.name: Saxon Kingdom
runners.comment: 0-9 on turf, ran well here off 65 in June last year, drawn wide, but can't discount
runners.spotlight: 0-9 on Flat turf and 0-19 overall; has shown enough to suggest he can win a race and he was only beaten 5l off 65 over 7f here in June of last year and races off 18lb lower today; drawn wide but he can't be fully discounted.

runners.name: Dancing Bay
runners.owner: Thomas B Breen & J P M Oconnor & Patrick Keogh
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, not obviously well treated, drawn wide; lacks a run, best watched
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant is not obviously well treated and he has been handed a very wide draw; lacks a recent run and can only be watched.

runners.name: Swiss Army Officer
runners.comment: 3-47, no win since May 2023, poorly drawn, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 3-47 on turf; no win since May 2023; lost form after close third of 14 at Tipperary last May; has run well fresh but is poorly drawn; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Torc Waterfall Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Swiss Army Officer was running in big fields at Leopardstown all season and was never beaten far. He needs his own way and he got it. Emmet kidded him along and he won well in the end. These races are probably ideal for him - Kevin Coleman, trainer.

runners.name: Onemoredance
runners.comment: Handicap debutante, 3yo is well drawn and could improve for 1m, check the market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; 3yo showed minor promise in three maidens last year at 5.5f-7f; well-drawn and could improve for the step up to a mile; check the market.

runners.name: Albion Princess
runners.comment: 1-10 on turf but that win was over three years ago, hard to fancy on recent form
runners.spotlight: 1-10 on turf but that win was over three years ago; no signs of that losing run coming to an end on recent starts at Dundalk over a variety of trips; hard to fancy on recent form

runners.name: Clever And Classy
runners.owner: Mrs Marguerite Bolger & Mrs J S Bolger
runners.comment: No impact in maidens or h'cap debut last year, 1lb wrong, bred to do better, check market
runners.spotlight: 3yo filly failed to make an impact in maidens and a similar story on her handicap debut; nicely drawn, is bred to do better and while she's 1lb wrong, Wesley Joyce's valuable 5lb claim negates that; worth a market check.

runners.name: Clarabell
runners.comment: Yet to trouble the judge in nine starts, four of them coming on turf, 5lb wrong, discount
runners.spotlight: Yet to trouble the judge in nine starts, four of them coming on turf; 5lb wrong and very hard to make a case for on what she has shown to date.

runners.name: Feature This
runners.comment: C&D winner off 3lb lower, engaged to run at Dundalk on Friday night; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; 4-24 on the AW and 1-11 on turf, the win coming over C&D last May off 55; remains 3lb higher and the visor and tongue tie go on; engaged to run at Dundalk on Friday night.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This likes it up here. I was trying to get her to stay further but that's probably her trip. There was not much pace which probably suited her. She battled well and will probably keep going up here for the winter - Paul Flynn, trainer

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Feature This got a grand ride from Robert, he did everything I asked. I thought she was a bit lairy so we stuck the cheekpieces on her but she did it well - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Annie Lavinia
runners.comment: Beaten 2l at Dundalk latest over 7f, 1m could suit, drawn wide, others preferred; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 0-2 on turf; has run well on a couple of occasions on the AW over 7f, including on latest when beaten just 2l; 1m could suit but she's drawn very wide; others preferred.

runners.name: Pub Talk
runners.comment: 1-6 on turf, pleasing stable debut at Dundalk latest, this trip more suitable; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 1-6 on turf and 2-16 on the AW; all three of his wins have come over 7f but he has placed over 1m; not a bad effort on first start for this yard at Dundalk latest over 6f; outside place claims.

quotes.race: Grant Thornton Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Pub Talk found a mile at Killarney too far and 5.5f at Navan too short, so we got it right in between here. Funnily enough, Colin (Keane) said our horse felt a bit intimidated by another horse (in the straight), and it wasn't until he put his whip down that he actually ran on. He came home well enough. Colin thinks fast surfaces or something like Dundalk will suit this horse so that's probably where we'll go - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: Joyful Prosperity
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Silas S S Yang & Michelle H Y Yang
runners.comment: Highly progressive at end of last year but that momentum has stalled; career best needed
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive at the end of last year, reeling of a hat-trick of victories, but that momentum has stalled in recent months; career best now required.

runners.name: Volcanic Spark
runners.comment: Stayed on well here last month but disappointed next time; 4lb above last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well for second over 1m1f here last month but disappointed next time; remains 4lb above his last winning mark and needs more.

runners.name: Serangoon

prev_owners.owner: D Mason, Dr C A Broxham Et Al

runners.comment: Gained his second local success but was well held off his revised mark two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Gained his second local success over 1m3f last month but was well held off his revised mark two weeks ago; something to prove now.

runners.name: Mighty Strength
runners.breeder: Simms Davison & Mrs J C Hewitt
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Li Ming On, Joyce Li Lok Yan & Henry Li Lok Him
runners.comment: Yet to score in five starts this term but has been competitive in most; steps up in trip
runners.spotlight: Landed a surprise win on his final outing last season; yet to score in five starts this term but has been competitive in most; steps up in trip.

runners.name: Mission Strike
runners.comment: Put a modest debut behind him with a pair of promising runs this year; chance
runners.spotlight: Put a modest debut behind him with a pair of promising runs this year; early breakthrough may be on the cards.

runners.name: Ace War
runners.comment: Left previous local form behind when making the frame two weeks ago; needs to back that up
runners.spotlight: Left previous local form behind when making the frame over 1m1f here two weeks ago; needs to back that up now.

quotes.race: Harrison College Your Future Your Choice Handicap
quotes.quote: King Of Spain is a half-brother to Mostly Cloudy we bought as a yearlong and he's probably got a better mind and is stronger physically than him. Given the pedigree, we did think he'd keep taking a big step forward between runs. His home work had been really strong since the Wolverhampton race, you could tell he'd really come forward. We thought the ground and trip would suit him but to see him do it in that fashion was really promising. He dug deep when the other horse came to him. We'd be keen to keep him off the quicker ground so he'll probably be quite busy now then have a bit of a break when the ground dries up - Gemma Tutty, trainer.

runners.name: Affordable
