runners.comment: Broke through in November; held off his revised mark and will need more to feature here
runners.spotlight: Broke through with a 1m3f success at Happy Valley in November; held off his revised mark since and will need more to feature here.

runners.name: Gale Saga
runners.comment: Hasn't been competitive since his latest success; new trip needs to bring improvement
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner this season but hasn't been competitive since his latest success; today's step up in trip needs to bring improvement.

runners.name: Rosewood Fleetfoot
runners.breeder: C P & Mrs M J A Howells
runners.owner: Lam Ka Lai & Yeung Wing Shut
runners.comment: Has shown little in two starts so far; can't be recommended at this stage.
runners.spotlight: Has shown little in two starts so far; can't be recommended at this stage.

runners.name: Firefoot
runners.comment: Made his breakthrough in January but has struggled off his revised mark since
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough with an extended mile win at Happy Valley in January but has struggled off his revised mark since; more needed.

runners.name: Good Good
runners.owner: Michael Ng Chi Lam & Gloria Ng Wong Yee Man
runners.comment: Off the mark over C&D in January and has remained competitive; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over C&D in January and has remained competitive in two subsequent runs; high on the list.

runners.name: Kasa Papa

prev_owners.owner: Dynamic Syndications Racing, J R Carter Et Al

runners.comment: Narrowly denied another success here two weeks ago; respected in current form
runners.spotlight: Broke through in a 1m1f Class 5 at Happy Valley in January and was narrowly denied another success here two weeks ago; respected in current form.

runners.name: Youth Power
runners.comment: In solid form this season; needs a bit more off his current mark but not ruled out
runners.spotlight: In solid form this season, scoring in both Class 5 and Class 4 comapny; needs a bit more off his current mark but not ruled out.

runners.name: Management Folks
runners.comment: Narrowly denied in November; recent efforts suggest he's close to another success
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied a third career win over 1m3f at Happy Valley in November; recent efforts suggest he's close to another success.

runners.name: Ping Hai Comet
runners.comment: Showed promise on his penultimate outing last season but largely disappointing
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on his penultimate outing last season but has largely disappointed in six career starts; others preferred.

runners.name: Hakka Radiance
runners.comment: Hinted at a breakthrough on several occasions this term; not dismissed if making the cut
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden who has hinted at a breakthrough on several occasions this term; not dismissed if making the cut.

stable_tour.quote: I have always liked this horse since the day he first set foot in the yard. He opened his account on his third outing, a 1m2f novice stakes at Chelmsford, although he is actually bred to be a miler. Next time out at Goodwood was a bit of an experiment but he failed to stay the extra trip of the Cocked Hat and didn't enjoy the undulations of the South Downs. He goes for the Britannia next week where the straight mile will suit. He is still on the upgrade, his work on fast ground has been good and we are looking forward to next week with him. 14-06-23

runners.name: Sky Trust
runners.owner: Bryan Kwan Hon Ming, Jessica Kwan Mun Hang Et Al
runners.comment: Placed in three C&D handicaps since 1m win in November but needs to find something extra
runners.spotlight: Placed in three C&D handicaps since 1m win in November but needs to find something extra to overcome current mark, and has awkward draw today.

runners.name: Charming Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: Began Hong Kong career with three creditable C&D runs; subsequent 1m defeat was excusable
runners.spotlight: Won readily over C&D on Hong Kong debut in November and ran well in defeat on next two outings; seemed to have a bit too much use made of him before weakening over 1m in January but drops back in trip today and remains very much of interest.

runners.name: Superb Kid

prev_owners.owner: Mrs E M F Ovenstone, A J Williams Et Al

runners.comment: Absent since C&D fifth last June and resumes on fairly tough mark
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D last season but we haven't seen him since his C&D fifth last June and he's still on a fairly tough mark.

runners.name: Spicy Gold
runners.comment: Career-best form when scoring over 6f this month; may have more to offer over 7f
runners.spotlight: Progressive 5yo who took his form to another new level when scoring over 6f at Happy Valley this month; recent 6lb rise demands even more from him but he could plausibly have untapped potential over 7f.

runners.name: Magnificent Nine
runners.comment: Consistent 5yo who won over C&D last month and went close here three weeks ago; respected
runners.spotlight: Consistent 5yo who belatedly opened Hong Kong account with fairly comfortable C&D last month and lost out only by a neck over C&D on latest outing; nudged up another 2lb since last time but likely to give another good account.

runners.name: Storming Dragon
runners.comment: Dual 6f course winner this season; well drawn today but seemingly on tough mark now
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner this season; has inside draw today and is still in good form but recent C&D runs suggest the handicapper has his measure now.

runners.name: Yuen Long Elite
runners.owner: Friend Of Yuen Long Merchants Assn Syndicate
runners.comment: Emphatic C&D winner in new blinkers in January but held in this higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Responded positively to addition of blinkers when keeping on strongly to win by 3l over C&D in January but had to settle for fifth when upped to this grade last month and his tendency to lose ground at the start remains a worry.

runners.name: Another World
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner this season and placed twice in this higher grade since; major player
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who won consecutive Class 4 C&D races in December/January and has been placed in this higher grade twice since (7f/1m); might still be on the upgrade; must be considered.

runners.name: Automated
runners.comment: Soundly beaten when 56-1 for last month's Hong Kong debut (6f)
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden in Australia last year but was soundly beaten when 56-1 for last month's Hong Kong debut (6f); subsequently gelded.

runners.name: Without Delay
runners.comment: 6f maiden winner in Australia last August; has awkward draw for Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner on debut in Australia last August but absent since fifth in 7f handicap the following month and has awkward draw for Hong Kong debut.

runners.name: Across Da Universe
runners.comment: Absent since C&D fifth in October but still unexposed in Hong Kong; considered each-way
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo who launched Hong Kong career with two encouraging runs towards end of last season and rebounded quickly from poor reappearance run when fifth over C&D in October; absent for another 168 days since but not ruled out each-way.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Buyin Buyin was strong at the finish and looked like he might get another furlong. He was workmanlike rather than spectacular but I'll take it. Hopefully we might run him in the Anglesey Stakes in a couple of weeks. I think he deserves to go and whether he is good enough we're not sure - Willie Browne, trainer.

runners.name: Sugar Ball
runners.owner: Lau Po Keung, Yee Shun Hung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Carringbush Park, Miss K A Brideoake & Ms L S Dillon

runners.comment: Dual 6f course winner in early part of season and still in good form; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f course winner in early part of this season and still in good form; encountered some traffic when only fifth over C&D three weeks ago and a recent 2lb drop helps; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Fast Network
runners.comment: 4-9; faces a tougher assignment today but another bold showing wouldn't surprise
runners.spotlight: Yet to finish outside the top four in nine career starts and has landed four victories; faces a tougher assignment today but another bold showing wouldn't surprise.

runners.name: Bottomuptogether
runners.comment: Returned to winning ways in January; needs to find more off this higher mark
runners.spotlight: Returned to winning ways when justifying short-odds over 5f on his penultimate outing; needs to find more off this higher mark to repeat the feat.

runners.name: Mid Winter Wind
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See
runners.comment: Made a strong impression on seasonal debut; may be suited by the return to this trip
runners.spotlight: Made a strong impression when staying on to score over C&D on seasonal debut; respectable effort over a mile last time and could be suited by the return to this trip.

runners.name: Whizz Kid
runners.comment: Made a promising reappearance but has disappointed in six outings since; tempting mark
runners.spotlight: Made a promising reappearance in October but has disappointed in six outings since; down to a tempting mark so not entirely ruled out.

runners.name: Superb Capitalist
runners.owner: Li Cham Kuen & Li Ming Choi
runners.comment: Looked to be going the right way earlier in the campaign but has lost his way recently
runners.spotlight: Looked to be going the right way earlier in the campaign but has lost his way recently; needs to produce a more convincing display.

runners.name: Harmony N Blessed
runners.owner: Cheung Ming Man, Cheung Ying Ho Et Al
runners.comment: Generally struggled off his higher rating; needs to show more from this reduced mark
runners.spotlight: Gained his eighth career win with a C&D success in September but has generally struggled off his higher rating since; needs to show more from this reduced mark.

runners.name: Stellar Express
runners.comment: Got off the mark in December but has gone off the boil in recently; needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark with a deserved win over 5f in December but has gone off the boil in recent starts; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Yiu Cheung Victory
runners.comment: Six-time Macau scorer; massive odds on three Hong Kong starts to date; needs further.
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner in Macau but always at 71/2f and beyond; dropping to Class 4 after three modest 7f runs to start his Hong Kong career; will surely find this trip too sharp.

runners.name: Victor The Rapid
runners.comment: British 7f winner who has yet to sparkle in four local starts; poor effort last time.
runners.spotlight: Third but beaten by 7l on his Hong Kong debut last June; three disappointments since then, including when last of 12 over this C&D on his Class 4 debut six weeks ago.

runners.name: Sea Emerald
runners.comment: Promising C&D second on debut three weeks ago; improvement likely with cheekpieces added.
runners.spotlight: Won a trial race and there was plenty to like about his C&D debut three weeks ago when he kept on well to finish 1.25l second as a 13-1 chance; cheekpieces now added.

runners.name: Blazing Beam
runners.owner: Roger Chan Tse Man & Bosco Chan
runners.comment: Good debut C&D run before finding life tougher last time; drawn wide.
runners.spotlight: Outran odds of 108-1 to finish 1.25l third over this C&D on his debut prior to lesser effort last time; should progress with experience; poorly drawn.

runners.name: Fortune Star
runners.owner: Kelvin Chan Kam Kei & Eddie Chan Kam Kong
runners.comment: Newcomer; needs to step up from modest trial form if he is to be involved in the finish.
runners.spotlight: Full brother to dual Hong Kong 6f scorer Super Charizzard; has failed to build on second place in the first of his six local trial races; it will be a surprise if he makes much impact on this debut appearance.

runners.name: Jubilant Winner
runners.comment: Back from a lay-off; good C&D third when fresh in September so is worth keeping an eye on.
runners.spotlight: Began this season with two good placed efforts before two lesser display; returning from almost four months off; placed in two recent trial races.

runners.name: Ka Ying Glory
runners.comment: Half-brother to the brilliant Ka Ying Rising; won two trials; comes with a big reputation.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to champion sprinter Ka Ying Rising who has performed well in all five trial starts, winning the last two; well drawn and a front-running debut success is a strong possibility.

runners.name: Magic Combo
runners.breeder: D T Champion, Llanhennock Trust & M
runners.owner: Tong Kin Hing, Dr Francis Siu Pui Sing & Siu Miu Man
runners.comment: Hard to fancy having finished last of 14 over 7f on his only start to date, six weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: NZ$250,000 two-year-old purchase who finished last of 14 as an 84-1 chance over 7f here on his only run six weeks ago; big improvement needed.

runners.name: Runjeet
runners.comment: Well bred son of Shalaa but has been disappointing in four trial races.
runners.spotlight: All three of his older siblings have won in sprint company but he has failed to impress in four local trial races and did not reach his reserve price at the yearling sales.

runners.name: Jumbo Treasure
runners.comment: Fair 5f third (though beaten by 4l) last time; cheekpieces added over an extra furlong.
runners.spotlight: Improved on creditable debut when finishing 4l third at odds of 9-1 over the minimum trip four weeks ago; step up to 6f and addition of cheekpieces may help.

runners.name: Super Sicario
runners.owner: Tony Lau Yiu Tong & Thomas Lau Sum Fai
runners.comment: Needs to leave the form of his two starts to date (both over this trip) well behind him.
runners.spotlight: Has been sent off at triple-figure odds on both of his starts to date and, after showing a glimmer of ability on his debut failed to beat a single rival last time (started slowly).

runners.name: Loving Vibes
runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Should be bang there at the finish once more following two narrow C&D reversals.
runners.spotlight: Make little impact in his first five starts, but his last four have been much improved and has been runner-up in photo finishes over C&D the last twice; upped 2lb; another big run is in prospect.

runners.name: Robot Knight
runners.comment: Two top four finishes in his last four runs; yet to make the top four in four turf starts.
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f here on dirt in October off a 4lb lower mark; some fair efforts in five starts since but looks like he is not so well suited by turf.

runners.name: Devildom
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Long-time maiden but did win a recent 6f dirt trial; needs to transfer that to the turf.
runners.spotlight: Outside the top four in all 14 Hong Kong outings; slight improvement on penultimate start (1m) and did win a 6f dirt trial race two weeks ago.

runners.name: Precious Hill
runners.comment: Won recent 6f dirt trial; has run poorly in both of his official starts thus far; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Has beaten a grand total of just one rival in two starts to date but is returning from almost six weeks away and has won a 6f dirt trial in the meantime.

runners.name: Sunny Sing Spirit
runners.comment: Newcomer who has not managed a top two finish in six trial races; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a pair of winners but cost only AUS$35,000 as a yearling and his performances in six trials have been underwhelming.

runners.name: Top Peak
runners.comment: Totally out of form and has health questions to answer after bleeding last time.
runners.spotlight: Hit a rich vein of form last spring (two 7f wins) but has finished stone last on all three starts this term and bled when last seen seven weeks ago.

runners.name: Sky Cap
runners.comment: Hard to recommend following four modest 5f efforts since arriving in Hong Kong.
runners.spotlight: Sowed promised in Australian 2yo events but completely unfancied and has run accordingly in four Hong Kong races; stepping up from 5f.

runners.name: Tactical Command
runners.breeder: Simms Davison & Mrs M P Schick
runners.comment: Looking to complete a 6f hat-trick after two Happy Valley triumphs; raised another 6lb.
runners.spotlight: Could not be in better form following two narrow 6f Happy Valley wins but has gone up by 11lb as a result and a third straight victory will require a new personal best.

runners.name: With A Smile
runners.comment: Two promising efforts thus far (denied clear run on debut); should continue to progress.
runners.spotlight: Looked unlucky when 1.75l sixth on debut then led briefly in the straight prior to finishing 1l fourth (both over this C&D); leading candidate of 1lb higher mark.

runners.name: Dash
runners.comment: Likely to build on his fair debut effort, when 4l seventh over this C&D two weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Mildly encouraging C&D debut when 4l seventh of 12 as a 30-1 chance two weeks ago; small improvement would see him in the shake-up.

runners.name: Dashing Pal
runners.comment: Fine effort when fifth on C&D debut; this looks a stronger race but cannot be ruled out.
runners.spotlight: Defied odds of 206-1 with a fine effort on his debut, staying on well late to be beaten 1.5l into fifth over C&D; that was probably a weak affair and likely to be suited by further in the future.

runners.name: Do Your Part
runners.comment: Showed first real glimmer of ability but still beaten by 4.5l last time; upped from 5f.
runners.spotlight: Best effort in six 5f starts to date when 4.5l fifth having been denied clear passage four weeks ago; this extra furlong may help but considerable further improvement needed.

runners.name: Little Paradise
runners.comment: Newcomer; has won the last two of his four local trials; fast break needed from wide draw.
runners.spotlight: Cost AUS$270,000 as a yearling and looks like he might live up to that price tag as he has won the last two of four trial race outings; wide draw makes things tougher but still respected.

runners.name: Truly Fluke
runners.comment: Has not shown enough in five trials to make him a likely debut scorer.
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to two winners, including a six-time sprint scorer; cost AUS$25,000n as a yearling; his five trial races (never better than third) suggest he is an unlikely first time out winner.

runners.name: Winning Machine
runners.owner: Sammy M H Kit, Johnny C T Cheung & Chan S Shui
runners.comment: Well bred but beaten in all four trials; likely to need a little time to get off the mark.
runners.spotlight: Has already failed to live up to his optimistic name with four trial race defeats; however, his dam won seven sprints and all his older half-sibling have won, so likely to have ability.

runners.name: Beauty Missile
runners.comment: Well handicapped on his best form but remains winless after 26 attempts.
runners.spotlight: Placed seven times in 26 career outings but yet to get his head in front; has been second off a 21lb higher mark than today's; will surely pop up at some point but has been expensive to follow.

runners.name: Bienvenue
runners.comment: Below his best last time; reproduction of his two previous efforts would see him go close.
runners.spotlight: Disappointed last time (held by With A Smile on that form) but second over this C&D on each of his two previous runs after the application of blinkers; sound claims if latest run is forgotten.

runners.name: Cosmic Spurs
runners.comment: Will be a big outsider after beginning his career with four poor efforts.
runners.spotlight: Yet to manage better than tenth in four career starts, including three over this C&D; others preferred.

runners.name: Happy For All
runners.comment: Has dropped to a good mark and latest 2.25l fourth was mildly encouraging,
runners.spotlight: Has come down 10lb in the rating since posting three consecutive good efforts around a year ago; latest 2.25l C&D fourth was slight improvement; has place claims.

runners.name: Sunny Darling

prev_owners.owner: James Harron Bloodstock Colts, Mrs B C Bateman Et Al

runners.comment: Needs to bounce back to the form that he showed in the autumn; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f on dirt here off 2lb lower in October but his last six starts have all been distinctly underwhelming.

runners.name: Rattan Galaxy
runners.comment: Newcomer; expensive purchase; has fair trial form but likely to need further; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Son of a 11.5f winner and half-brother to two winners who fetched NZ450,000 as a two-year-old; placed in two of his six trials but will probably want further than 6f.

runners.name: Beauty Eternal
runners.comment: Dual C&D Pattern winner (including Group 1); hinted at return to form last time.
runners.spotlight: Surprise front-running C&D Group 1 winner 11 months ago; has not been successful in five starts since but should be able to get to the lead here and ran well over 7f last time.

quotes.race: FWD Champions Mile (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was the only hope we had to go forward from Beauty Eternal's draw as there was no speed in the race. They gave us the opportunity to lead and he got into a lovely rhythm and controlled the race. I thought this was the only way we could beat Golden Sixty. I've always felt there was a bit more there, and we saw his full potential - Zac Purton, jockey.

runners.name: Beauty Joy
runners.owner: Eleanor Kwok Law Kwai Chun & Patrick Kwok Ho Chuen
runners.comment: Defending champion; form this season has been a touch below par; back from ten weeks off.
runners.spotlight: Winless in nine tries since beating four of today's rivals in this race 12 months ago (he also finished third in it in 2023); has been freshened up by a ten-week break so cannot be left out of calculations.

runners.name: Galaxy Patch
runners.comment: Has strong C&D form including Group 1 second in January; unsuited by 1m2f last time.
runners.spotlight: Triple C&D Group winner who was beaten by 2.5l or less in three C&D events (finished in front of four of these opponents in January) prior to finding 1m2f too far last time.

runners.name: Chancheng Glory
runners.comment: Recent Group 3 winner but needs to find a bit more to break through at this level.
runners.spotlight: Career highlight was a Group 3 handicap triumph over 1m1f here in January; solid Group 1 run over 1m2f since; has 2.5l to find on Galaxy Patch from their last C&D meeting.

runners.name: Ensued
runners.comment: Group 1 second latest; has enjoyed another fine campaign; may find 1m on the sharp side.
runners.spotlight: Has not run over as short as 1m since he left Britain but continued his fine season with a solid second (1.25l in front of Chancheng Glory) in 1m2f Group 1 last time.

runners.name: Happy Together
runners.comment: Usually comes up short in this vaunted company, including when fifth in this a year ago.
runners.spotlight: Fifth in this race last year; beaten in all seven Group starts since then, though his close second over 1m1f in a Group 3 in January was a commendable effort.

runners.name: Red Lion
runners.owner: The Hon Ronald Arculli Gbm Gbs Jp & Johanna K J Arculli Bbs
runners.comment: Sneaked place at odds of 86-1 in January C&D Group 1; third in this last year; poor draw.
runners.spotlight: Beaten in all 11 Group outings (including third in this race 12 months ago), though has been placed in three Group 1s; wide draw makes things tougher.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels And Resorts Handicap
quotes.quote: Fiach McHugh won his maiden in Dundalk. He was second to Ivy League then when he ran too free over 1m and that's why we dropped back to 7f. We settled out the back today and I think he'll get a mile ridden like that. We might give him an entry in the Britannia Stakes at Ascot - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Straight Arron
runners.comment: Dual Pattern Race winner but has not been at his peak in five starts so far this term.
runners.spotlight: Won a Group 3 and a Group 2 last season when with Caspar Fownes but has not excelled since switching to this yard; behind plenty of these in his two 2025 starts.

runners.name: La City Blanche
runners.comment: Placed in two 1m1f Group 3 events this term but likely to find 1m too short.
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m4f Group 3 11 months ago but has been inconsistent this season and surely needs further to be seen at this best; behind five of these over 1m1f in January.

runners.name: Moments In Time
runners.comment: Short-head Class 1 handicap scorer last time but has much more on his plate here.
runners.spotlight: Chilean Group 1 hero who broke an 11-month losing streak when landing a 1m Class 1 handicap at Happy Valley last month; has a mountain to climb at level weights in this company.

runners.name: Nimble Nimbus
runners.comment: Group 3 winner who began the season with two solid runs; four lesser efforts snce.
runners.spotlight: Landed a 1m1f Group 3 13 months ago but no better than third in ten starts since then and his three 2025 efforts have been way below his best.

runners.name: Sunlight Power
runners.comment: In fine form in handicaps this term; this represents the stiffest task of his career.
runners.spotlight: Making his Group-race debut today following two Class 2 C&D handicap victories in his last three starts; stiff task here at level weights but is firmly on the upgrade.

runners.name: Horsepower
runners.owner: Michael T H Lee, Vanessa Lee & Amelia Lee

prev_owners.owner: Michael T H Lee & Vanessa Lee

runners.comment: Ex-Australian 4yo who launched Hong Kong career with two ready 5f wins; major player
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo who launched his Hong Kong career with two ready 5f wins, the latter over C&D six weeks ago; drawn on the wing today, which is not ideal, but it remains hard to gauge the limit of his ability.

runners.name: Packing Bole
runners.comment: 6f dirt winner in December but needs to prove himself over this C&D
runners.spotlight: In very good form over 6f on dirt towards end of last year but last month's run on that surface was below par and he needs to prove himself over this C&D.

runners.name: Fast Responder
runners.owner: Hong Kong St John Presidents Club Syndicate
runners.comment: Scored over C&D in January but well held here since; too unreliable
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong at sixth attempt, with pushed-out C&D win in January, but finished well down the field here last month and is evidently not one to rely upon.

quotes.race: Newmarket Academy Godolphin Beacon Project Cornwallis Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I wasn't that confident beforehand (because of the ground), but Inquisitively is a very tough horse. He took the lead and grabbed the race from the get go. When I saw three horses in line halfway through the race I was a bit worried, but as William says he breathes very well and relaxes. When he asked him to quicken up he put it to bed very nicely. I think he is a five-furlong horse, but we will probably have to try the six (furlongs) later down the line. He was sold to go to Hong Kong, but he worked very well at mine so I asked if I could run him at York. He ran at York and won, and we decided to go for one more today. I would love to keep him, but we will have to speak to the owner. You have a question mark on the Breeders' Cup obviously. It is a long way out and we will have to discuss. It is not out of the question - Kevin Philippart de Foy, trainer.

runners.name: Super Fortune
runners.comment: Won in good style over C&D December and last month's third was another big run; respected
runners.spotlight: Scored in pretty good style over C&D in December and probably bettered that performance when close third behind Horsepower here last month; remains on a tough mark but still respected in current form.

runners.name: La Forza
runners.comment: Made all for clearcut C&D win on seasonal/handicap debut; up in grade today; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D novice race last season and made all for clearcut C&D success on last month's belated reappearance/handicap debut (first-time blinkers); hiked up 10lb for that and moves up in grade today but still needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Marvel And Gold
runners.comment: 2-2 over 6f in New Zealand; makes Hong Kong debut after eight-month absence
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over 6f when trained in New Zealand (maiden/handicap); could have a good future in Hong Kong but has fitness to prove after eight-month absence.

runners.name: Flying Ting Lok
runners.comment: Weakened out of contention on recent Hong Kong debut (6f)
runners.spotlight: Won over 5.5f in Australia last year but weakened out of contention on recent Hong Kong debut (6f); needs that run to have brought him on.

runners.name: Star Performer
runners.comment: 1-7 in South Africa; makes HK debut after more than a year off; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Ended seven-race career in South Africa with 5f maiden win last March but this Hong Kong debut comes after more than a year on the sidelines; probably best watched.

runners.name: Carroll Street
runners.owner: Winston Wong Ching Wah, Bobby Fong Kwok Wah Et Al
runners.comment: Five-time C&D winner; out of form this season but now too well handicapped to ignore
runners.spotlight: Well below best form this season but this five-time C&D winner is favourably drawn against the nearside rail today and has become too well handicapped to ignore.

runners.name: Aurora Patch

prev_owners.owner: Ms R A Fowler, M E Izatt & A R Davison

runners.comment: Unexposed in HK and belied 67-1 odds when close second over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only four Hong Kong starts and outran 67-1 odds when close second to Horsepower over C&D six weeks ago; no surprise if he's on the premises again.

runners.name: Circuit Jolly
runners.owner: Chang Wing Yiu & Cheung Kwong Kwan
runners.comment: C&D winner in January and placed over 6f in this higher grade since; still lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Delivered on earlier promise when making all over C&D in January, his fourth run, and kept on for creditable third at Happy Valley (6f) when upped to this grade this month; may still have a bigger run in him back at 5f.

runners.name: Northern Beaches
runners.comment: Out of form over 7f at end of last season; returns from 288-day layoff
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D in December 2023 but ended last season with some disappointing 7f runs and has been off for 288 days; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Ka Ying Rising
runners.comment: Firmly established as the best sprinter in the world; ought to add to his haul of wins
runners.spotlight: Ten wins in a row, the last three times in very good style in Group 1 races here (6f-7f); now firmly established as the best sprinter in the world and ought to be very difficult to beat.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Sprint (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Ka Ying Rising was working the whole way and never had time to relax. He wasn't at his best and is better than this but still go the job done - Zac Purton, rider.

runners.name: California Spangle

prev_owners.owner: The Exors Of The Estate Of The Late Howard Liang Yum Shing

runners.comment: Three-time Group 1 winner; not firing on all cylinders this season, though
runners.spotlight: Three-time Group 1 winner, most recently in Al Quoz Sprint at Meydan a year ago; can give Ka Ying Rising a race if back to his best but has not been firing on all cylinders this season.

quotes.race: Al Quoz Sprint Sponsored by AZIZI Developments (Group 1) (Turf)
quotes.quote: If you look back through his history, California Spangle on his debut, he ran a record time in Hong Kong and he ran a record time at 1200m. I believe when he hits the front, nobody can catch him. I think we'll go into sprint races back in Hong Kong, that's the end of April (the Group 1 Chairman's Sprint Prize). We'll take on Lucky Sweynesse. He's always been a sprinter-miler and I believe he's more a sprinter than a miler. You have to go for those longer races in Hong Kong earlier in their career but I think we know where he is best now - Tony Cruz, trainer.

quotes.race: Longines Hong Kong Mile (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: California Spangle is a lot more relaxed this season and he kept coming back underneath me. I kept trying to click him along but he was waiting for the other horses. I think we've seen today that he is a little bit versatile - Zac Purton, jockey, speaking to HKJC.

runners.name: Helios Express
runners.comment: Placed behind Kay Ying Rising on all five starts this season; should go well again
runners.spotlight: Placed behind Ka Ying Rising on all five starts this season, the last three times at Group 1 level (6f-7f); likely to give another good account and be on the premises again but needs his old rival to fluff his lines.

runners.name: Lucky With You
runners.comment: Late-maturing 7yo who has been in career-best form lately; can collect a minor prize
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 7yo who has been in career-best form in recent weeks, winning two Class 1 handicaps over C&D; in his current mood, he has a very good chance to collect a minor prize.

runners.name: Magic Control

prev_owners.owner: Carringbush Park Syndicate, Miss K A Brideoake & M D Laurie

runners.comment: Won 5f Class 2 handicap last month but has quite a bit to find at this level
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who won 5f Class 2 handicap quite stylishly here last month; managed only sixth behind Lucky With You over C&D three weeks ago, though, and is 1lb worse off with that rival today.

runners.name: Copartner Prance
runners.comment: Very consistent in handicaps this year but has a lot more on his plate today
runners.spotlight: In the frame in four consecutive C&D handicaps this year, most recently when second to Lucky With You three weeks ago, but has a lot more on his plate today.

runners.name: Gorgeous Win
runners.comment: Consistent and progressive in handicaps this season but faces a tough task today
runners.spotlight: Consistent and progressive in handicaps this season, collecting two C&D wins along the way; posted another career best when second last month but was no match for Lucky With You and is 6lb worse off with him today.

runners.name: Capital Legend
runners.comment: Dips in grade after very respectable 6f run this month; this longer trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Found things quite tough in Class 3 after 1m Class 4 win in October but dips back into this grade after perfectly respectable 6f run this month, and today's move back up in trip is another positive; shortlisted.

runners.name: Endued
runners.comment: Ran on well four fourth over 6f when dropped to this grade; well worth a crack at 7f
runners.spotlight: Suffered dip in form after promising Hong Kong debut in November but, having dropped to this grade, ran on well for fourth at Happy Valley (6f) this month; looks well worth a crack at 7f and features prominently in calculations; swaps blinkers for first-time visor.

runners.name: South Star
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo who went close over C&D last month and should still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who built upon his promising debut when close second over C&D last month; went up 2lb for that and is drawn much wider today but could still have significant potential.

runners.name: Rich Horse
runners.comment: Won on debut in Ireland in 2023 but has struggled to get seriously competitive in HK
runners.spotlight: Won on debut in Ireland in 2023 but has struggled to get seriously competitive on his first five Hong Kong starts.

runners.name: Max Que
runners.owner: Ricky Ng Yu Chiu & To Ngo Fung
runners.comment: Lost only narrowly after finishing well over C&D last month and remains lightly raced
runners.spotlight: Has improved since his inauspicious debut in November and lost out only by a neck after staying on well over C&D last month; will presumably be dropped in again from his wide draw today; no surprise if he features.

runners.name: Virtuous Phantom
runners.owner: Andrew Fan Chun Wah & Karson Choi Ka Tsan
runners.comment: Won a recent trial and evidently has some ability; makes official debut today
runners.spotlight: Out of an unraced mare who has produced three winning sprinters; won a recent 6f trial and evidently has some ability; sports blinkers on this official debut.

runners.name: Wrote A New Page
runners.owner: Sammy Ma Hon Kit & Ronald Ma Chun Ho
runners.comment: Unlucky not to finish closer than seventh over C&D this month and remains very unexposed
runners.spotlight: Very unexposed after only two runs and was unlucky not to finish closer than seventh over C&D three weeks ago, having encountered traffic when keeping on inside the final furlong; interesting.

runners.name: California Blitz

prev_owners.owner: The Exors Of The Estate Of The Late Howard Liang Yum Shing

runners.comment: Bettered his low-key debut when keeping-on fifth over C&D last month; may progress again
runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key debut when keeping-on fifth over C&D last month; will need to take another step forward to overcome his wide draw today but that's possible.

runners.name: Bling Bling Genius
runners.comment: Finished well down the field on first two outings; not the most obvious answer
runners.spotlight: Finished well down the field on first two outings (6f/7f) and is not the most obvious answer today.

runners.name: The Auspicious
runners.comment: Displayed sudden jolt of improvement when shock C&D winner this month, his sixth start
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on first five starts but displayed sudden jolt of improvement and finished strongly from the rear to cause 132-1 shock over C&D three weeks ago; now needs to build on that performance.

runners.name: Happy Universe
runners.comment: Down the field over C&D this month and has now been unplaced all seven starts
runners.spotlight: Belied 109-1 odds when respectable sixth over C&D last month but his subsequent run behind The Auspicious here was a backward step and he has now been unplaced all seven starts.

runners.name: Draco
runners.comment: In the frame all three starts for new stable this year and still unexposed over 7f
runners.spotlight: In the frame all three runs for new stable this year, most recently when third over C&D six weeks ago; not ideally drawn today but remains unexposed over 7f; ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Only U
runners.comment: Regressive maiden with quite a lot to prove at present
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season C&D form but this regressive maiden has lots to prove after some very disappointing 1m runs this year.

runners.name: He Was You
runners.comment: Yet to pose a significant threat after six sprint runs; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Yet to pose a significant threat after six sprint runs; needs this step up in trip to unlock improvement.

runners.name: Mighty Steed
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with a below-par run but his early-season form was encouraging
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a disappointing C&D run and is now 0-6 but some of his early-season 7f/1m runs were very encouraging and he has possibilities if back on song after four-month break.

runners.name: Always My Folks
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Second over 6f here in January but yet to build on that performance
runners.spotlight: Improved form when second over 6f here in January, his third run, but some lesser efforts have followed and he was particularly disappointing when upped to 7f a week ago.

runners.name: Packing Power
runners.comment: Began career with three convincing 6f wins last year but not much has gone to plan since
runners.spotlight: Began career with three convincing 6f wins last year but not much has gone to plan since; took step back in right direction when sixth here in January but needs to do better again today and Hugh Bowman evidently prefers Crossborderpegasus.

runners.name: Chateauneuf
runners.comment: Largely consistent 4yo who is still on a workable mark; each-way claims at least
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent 4yo who was denied a clear run at a crucial stage when sixth at Happy Valley this month; still on a workable mark; each-way claims at least.

runners.name: Ka Ying Victory
runners.comment: Yet to hit top gear after three runs this season; needs a boost from the cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Dual 5f winner last season; also suited by 6f but is yet to hit top gear after three starts this season and is still on a fairly tough mark; needs a boost from the first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Beauty Crescent
runners.comment: Placed several times over 7f this season but remains a local maiden after 28 starts
runners.spotlight: Frustrating 5yo who has been placed several times over 7f here this season but remains a local maiden after 28 starts; drawn wide today and not sure to be suited by the drop back to 6f; others preferred.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Colin (Keane) was at his best there and deserves full credit. I debated leaving the blinkers off Beauty Crescent as he ran keen to post at the Curragh and is fresh but Colin did the right thing at the start in pulling him out to think of another day. They've pulled 12 lengths clear so it's a good performance from the front two. His future is in Hong Kong. I'd imagine after speaking to (his owner) Mr (Simon) Kwok that we'll put him into quarantine and send him on - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Crossborderpegasus
runners.comment: Exciting 3yo who won cosily over C&D on his first two starts; obvious contender
runners.spotlight: Exciting 3yo who won cosily over C&D on his first two starts (both last month); moves up in grade today but could easily have a lot more in the locker.

runners.name: Sunny Da Best
runners.comment: Before at Happy Valley this month but looked in good nick over C&D beforehand
runners.spotlight: Rather disappointing at Happy Valley this month but was in good form over C&D beforehand, notably when winning in January, and is not yet fully exposed; enters calculations.

runners.name: Aeris Nova

prev_owners.owner: C Bennett, Flying Start Fine Scent Et Al

runners.comment: Placed over C&D in January but subsequent form has been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Suggested his turn might be near when placed over C&D in January, his fourth Hong Kong start, but subsequent 6f-1m form has been underwhelming; needs to up his game.

runners.name: Fortune Supernova
runners.breeder: T R Pascoe, Vicki Pascoe Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Angela Boyd, Chrissie Dalgety Et Al

runners.comment: 5f maiden winner in New Zealand last June; has double-digit draw for Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Delivered on debut promise when winning 5f maiden in New Zealand last June but has double-digit draw for this Hong Kong debut; considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.name: Mojave Desert
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See
runners.comment: Won on dirt on stable debut in December and has remained in good form since (incl. turf)
runners.spotlight: Won on dirt here on stable debut in December and has remained in good form since (including on turf); does not appear to have much margin for error off current mark but it's possible the refitted cheekpieces will squeeze out something extra.

runners.name: Call Me Gorgeous
runners.breeder: Grimley B B A Pty Ltd
runners.comment: 0-4 in HK but has shown significant promise this year and has the inside draw today
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo; yet to be placed after four Hong Kong starts this year but has shown significant promise on two occasions and continues to slip down the weights; could have a say from stall 1.

runners.name: Sal
runners.comment: Well beaten on all three Hong Kong starts and now eligible for lower-grade races
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on all three Hong Kong starts (5f-6f) and now eligible for lower-grade races.

7:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM
